snippet: Timothy F. Geithner, former Treasury secretary, takes credit for what most experts agree was largely a success. But it came with a price: more cynicism and distrust toward both government and the big banks.

byline.original: By ALBERT R. HUNT | BLOOMBERG VIEW

lead_paragraph: Timothy F. Geithner, former Treasury secretary, takes credit for what most experts agree was largely a success. But it came with a price: more cynicism and distrust toward both government and the big banks.

headline.main: Averting Disaster, but at What Cost?
headline.print_headline: Averting Disaster, but at What Cost?
